entry.title: Walkout Planned at Winston Middle School to Address Bullying Concerns
entry.summary: A student-led walkout is planned Monday at Winston Middle School to raise awareness about bullying and safety concerns. Organized by 13-year-old Ashton, the event has gained attention from parents and community members online.

entry.title: LOCAL WINE PIONEER PHILIPPE GIRARDET HAS PASSED AWAY
entry.summary: (Story from information provided by Jack Costa of the Umpqua Valley Winegrowers Association) November 8, 2025 11:10 a.m. A pioneer in the Umpqua Valley wine industry has passed away. Philippe Girardet was the founder of Girardet Vineyards and Winery in Tenmile. The Swiss American was an astrophysics engineer at the California Institute of Technology before...

entry.title: UCAN will operate Roseburg Warming Center for third year
entry.summary: As temperatures drop, staff with United Community Action Network (UCAN) are preparing to operate the Roseburg Warming Center again this winter for the third consecutive year.

entry.title: DENSE FOG ADVISORY THROUGH 10:00 A.M. SATURDAY
entry.summary: November 8, 2025 5:50 a.m. A Dense Fog Advisory remains in effect for much of southwestern Oregon through 10:00 a.m. Saturday. Forecasters at the National Weather Service in Medford said visibility of one quarter mile or less is expected in dense fog. The Advisory area includes central Douglas County, eastern Curry County, Josephine and Jackson...

entry.title: PacifiCorp Credit Downgrade Raises Bankruptcy Concerns Amid Wildfire Lawsuits
entry.summary: PacifiCorp, the Oregon-based utility owned by Warren Buffett, warns of a potential liquidity crisis amid lawsuits over the 2020 wildfires. Facing billions in damages and credit downgrades, the company says ongoing litigation threatens its long-term operations.

entry.title: Canyonville ODOT Station Retains Funding, Continues Key Role in Highway Safety
entry.summary: The Canyonville ODOT station will remain fully staffed after avoiding budget cuts. The small crew plays a vital role in keeping I-5 and nearby highways safe, responding quickly to winter storms, emergencies, and incidents across southern Douglas County.

entry.title: INSIDE DOUGLAS COUNTY 11.7.25
entry.summary: Christopher Hudson of Lexeme Wines and Jack Costa of the Umpqua Valley Wine Growers Association talk about this year’s harvest, the upcoming Winesgiving Weekend and other related topics in this Wine in the Umpqua program.

entry.title: Upscale Resale to Close After 30 Months, Offers Half-Off Storewide Sale
entry.summary: Upscale Resale in Sutherlin is closing at the end of November after 30 months in business. The consignment shop is offering half off all items and waiving its share of sales as a thank-you to the community for its support.

entry.title: GOVERNOR ANNOUNCES THAT OREGONIANS NOW HAVE ACCESS TO SNAP BENEFITS
entry.summary: November 7, 2025 10:50 a.m. Thursday afternoon, a federal court ordered the Trump administration to immediately release 100 percent of funding to pay for Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program benefits for all recipients nationwide by Friday, including more than 750,000 Oregonians. A release from the Governor’s Office said following Governor Tina Kotek’s directive, the Oregon Department...

entry.title: Pretrial Motions Filed in Oakland Homicide Case
entry.summary: Attorneys for Dwayne Michael Lauka have filed multiple motions ahead of his February trial in the death of Terry Lea Deane, including a challenge to palm print evidence. Prosecutors maintain the evidence is valid and relevant to the case.

entry.title: ROSEBURG POLICE CITE WOMAN FOR DRIVING WHILE SUSPENDED
entry.summary: November 7, 2025 10:30 a.m. Roseburg Police cited a woman for driving while suspended on Thursday. An RPD report said at 4:45 p.m. the 41-year-old was pulled over by an officer near Gaddis Park in the 800 block of Northwest Highland Street, because there were no license plates on her vehicle. The woman’s license was...

entry.title: Oregon Taxpayers to Receive 9.863% “Kicker” Credit After $1.41 Billion Surplus
entry.summary: Oregon residents will receive a 9.863% “kicker” credit on 2025 tax returns after a $1.41 billion surplus was confirmed. The credit will boost refunds or reduce taxes owed, with details available through the Oregon Department of Revenue.

entry.title: ROSEBURG POLICE CITE MAN FOR ALLEGED CRIMINAL MISCHIEF
entry.summary: November 7, 2025 10:20 a.m. Roseburg Police cited a man for third-degree criminal mischief on Thursday. An RPD report said at 3:30 p.m. a 38-year-old man was contacted for allegedly trespassing on the property of a business in the 3000 block of Northwest Stewart Parkway. Officers learned there was probable cause to arrest the man...

entry.title: ROSEBURG POLICE JAIL MAN FOR WARRANT FOLLOWING TRAFFIC STOP
entry.summary: November 7, 2025 10:10 a.m. Roseburg Police jailed a man for a warrant following a traffic stop on Thursday afternoon. An RPD report said at 1:30 p.m. officers pulled over a large SUV for violations and contacted the 46-year-old man as the driver. Dispatch advised and confirmed the warrants. The man’s driving status was suspended...

entry.title: ROSEBURG POLICE JAIL MAN FOR VIOLATION OF NO CONTACT ORDER
entry.summary: November 7, 2025 10:00 a.m. Roseburg Police jailed a man for violation of a no contact order on Thursday afternoon. An RPD report said just before 5:00 p.m. the 33-year-old was contacted at a motel in the 3100 block of Northwest Aviation Drive. A protected person said the man had been a guest in her...

entry.summary: November 7, 2025 9:40 a.m. Roseburg Police jailed two people for warrants early Friday morning. An RPD report said at approximately 3:15 a.m. the 21-year-old man from Sutherlin and 21-year-old woman from Roseburg were contacted in the 2400 block of Northwest Kline Street. This followed reports of suspicious individuals around the area of Northwest Sunberry...

entry.title: ROSEBURG POLICE JAIL MAN FOR RESTRAINING ORDER VIOLATION
entry.summary: October 7, 2025 9:20 a.m. Roseburg Police jailed a man for a restraining order violation on Thursday. entry.title: Roseburg library adds digital newspapers
entry.summary: Roseburg Public Library now offers access to thousands of digital newspapers through NewsBank.

entry.title: Join the growing trend of planting olive trees in your garden
entry.summary: Question: I love olive trees. Can we grow them in Roseburg?

entry.title: LOCAL REAL ESTATE TODAY 11.7.25
entry.summary: Mary Gilbert of the Mary Gilbert Group, powered by PLACE, at Keller Williams Southern Oregon has our weekly local look at real estate.

entry.title: MORNING CONVERSATION 11.7.25
entry.summary: Roseburg High School Theater instructor Troy Pennington talks about their upcoming production of Shakespeare’s “Macbeth”.

entry.title: Oregon SNAP Benefits Fully Restored After Federal Court Ruling
entry.summary: Oregonians can now access their full November SNAP benefits after a federal court ordered the Trump Administration to release withheld funds. The Oregon Department of Human Services confirmed payments are restored, following Gov. Tina Kotek’s declaration of a hunger emergency.

entry.title: Canyonville ODOT receives funding, able to stay open in time for winter
entry.summary: CANYONVILLE — Most highways around Douglas County are maintained by the Oregon Department of Transportation (ODOT), keeping all travelers on safe routes. Like Roseburg crew manager Randy Camp said Oct. 29, the public expects safe road to travel on, especially…

entry.title: Oakland murder case heats up
entry.summary: Editors note: This article references a brutal murder, and contains language and information that may not be appropriate for some readers, especially children.

entry.title: Stewart Park Drive Bridge reopens after rehabilitation project
entry.summary: The Stewart Park Drive Bridge reopened Tuesday night after being closed to vehicle traffic for several months. The bridge, spanning the South Umpqua River, closed in February for a major rehabilitation project.

entry.summary: The Roseburg Receiver Morning Scoop

entry.title: Columbia Bank, UCAN team up for November donation barrels
entry.summary: Senior Vice President at Columbia Bank David Adamson said Thursday that Columbia Bank is committed to helping people.

entry.title: Healing through rafting: Paul Eckel documents journey post service
entry.summary: Paul Eckel said his time in the U.S. Army and Central Intelligence Agency (CIA) turned him into a tested combatant, but his time in the North Umpqua River has healed him immensely.

entry.title: Communicating around the waters: Paul Romero reflects on his Navy service
entry.summary: Paul Romero said he originally joined the U.S. Navy to pay off college with a GI bill.

entry.title: FESTIVAL OF LIGHTS PREPARES FOR ITS 33RD YEAR
entry.summary: November 7, 2025 3:30 a.m. The 33rd season of the Umpqua Valley Festival of Lights, organized by the Roseburg Rotary Club, will launch on Sunday November 23rd, kicking off a series of special events to celebrate opening week. entry.title: DINT Arrests Myrtle Creek Man in Roseburg Drug Investigation
entry.summary: DINT detectives arrested 38-year-old Chet Evans of Myrtle Creek in Roseburg after finding suspected fentanyl, meth residue, and weapons. Evans faces drug and weapons charges and remains in custody on a Lane County probation detainer.

entry.title: DINT MAKES METH/FENTANYL/WEAPONS ARREST ON WEDNESDAY
entry.summary: November 6, 2025 4:20 p.m. The Douglas Interagency Narcotics Team made a meth, fentanyl and weapons arrest near downtown Roseburg on Wednesday. DINT Commander Lieutenant Rick McArthur said detectives witnessed possible drug activity within the intersection of Northeast Odell Avenue and Northeast Caspar Avenue. At approximately 9:45 a.m. with assistance of the Douglas County Sheriff’s...

entry.title: Myrtle Creek man arrested in Roseburg on drugs and weapons charges
entry.summary: Detectives from the Douglas Interagency Narcotics Team (DINT) made a significant arrest Wednesday following suspected drug activity in Roseburg.

entry.summary: Kyle Bailey was live at Aviva Health’s Vets and Their Pets event, talking with staff from Aviva and a number of veterans.

entry.title: Roseburg Man Arrested, Released on Bail in First-Degree Sexual Abuse Case
entry.summary: Jason Nathaniel Briggs, 43, of Roseburg, was arrested Oct. 28 on a charge of first-degree sexual abuse and later released on bail. Court records show three no-contact orders were issued. He’s due back in court Dec. 15 for a status hearing. The case remains under investigation.

A semi-truck pulling a trailer in the fast lane and...

entry.title: MORNING CONVERSATION 11.7.25
entry.summary: Umpqua Community Foundation Chief Executive Officer Jessica Paugh talks about the Legacy Ball, happening on Friday night. Tickets are still available.

entry.title: Southbound I-5 semi-truck fire near Winston extinguished
entry.summary: Fire crews extinguished a semi-truck fire on I-5 southbound near Winston Thursday morning. The blaze started in the engine compartment and spread to the cab and trailer loaded with paper rolls. No injuries were reported, and the cause is under investigation.
